Package main.java

Class ChessGameLauncher

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
main.java.ChessGameLauncher
public class ChessGameLauncher extends javafx.application.Application
Main class for launching the Chess game application. This is generated dynamically rather than through a .fxml file. This class sets up the user interface and handles the game's main functionalities.

  • Method Details

    • setTimeControl

      public void setTimeControl(int timeInSeconds, int incrementInSeconds)
      Sets the time control for the game.
      Parameters:
      timeInSeconds - The main time for each player in seconds.
      incrementInSeconds - The increment per move in seconds. When a move is made, the player gets this amount of time back.

    • setPlayerNames

      public void setPlayerNames(String whitePlayerName, String blackPlayerName)
      Sets the names of the players.
      Parameters:
      whitePlayerName - The name of the white player.
      blackPlayerName - The name of the black player.

    • initializeUI

      public void initializeUI(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Initializes the user interface for the Chess game.
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The primary stage for this application.

    • init

      public void init()
      Initialization method called before the application starts. Processes command line arguments in order to pass in time controls.
      Overrides:
      init in class javafx.application.Application

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage) throws Exception
      Starts the JavaFX app. This method is called after the init() method has returned.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - The primary stage for this application.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during application start.
